results.title: Curriculum by Technology
results.creator_credit: Brendan Kenworthy, Bendigo Education Resource Centre, TV Ed Productions and Victoria. Ministry of Education
results.brief_description: Shows how Bendigo Education Resource Centre is introducing new technology into distance education to increase the range of curriculum subjects offered for Year 11 and 12 students in isolated schoolos in the Mallee area: Telepaks, telephone links, fax machines, Macintosh computers, lessons on VHS tapes. Introduction by Justin Shortal.

results.title: Computing History: Teaching With a New Technology
results.creator_credit: David Tiley, Penny Robins, Commonwealth Schools Commission (Australia) and Video Projects

video_links.name: Computing History: Teaching With a New Technology

results.brief_description: Looks at the use of computers as word-processors and databases in the teaching of history. Programs such as database, newsroom and open database are shown being used. The program also highlights some of the problems, and some of the advantages of using this approach to the teaching of history.

results.title: Adventure Games in the Classroom
results.creator_credit: Stephen Skok and Victoria. Ministry of Education
results.brief_description: Outlines how to integrate the computer into the classroom by using an adventure games approach. The emphasis is on situations where only one computer per class is available.

results.title: Wandering Thru' the Centre
results.brief_description:
A travel film through the centre of Australia. Features the Flying Doctor’s Base at Alice Springs, The Devil’s Marble near Wanchop, Darwin beach and harbour and many other tourist delights to be found en route from Alice Springs to Darwin.

Digitising Technician Note: Film contains footage of the making of “The Overlanders” (1946). Noted by Ben Abbott 09/01/2018

results.title: The Queen Returns
results.creator_credit: Frank Bagnall, Stanley Hawes and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: The visit of Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth and His Royal Highness Prince Phillip to Australia. Much of the film is devoted to Canberra and its history as the Queen’s visit coincided with Canberra’s Jubilee Celebrations.

results.title: Silent Number
results.creator_credit: Jamie Blanks, Hugh Burton and Victorian College of the Arts, School of Film and Television
results.brief_description: Babysitter Nicole is subjected to a horrific night of phone calls from a guy called Matt, claiming to be beaten by his father and imprisoned in a cold place. When a bloodied man comes to the door claiming that he and his wife have been in an accident, she decides it is time to call the police. Cast includes Bronwyn Jones and John Brumpton.
